item.title: Hardening Apache Web Server
item.description: A collection of example configurations and scripts to aid system administrators in hardening Apache web servers. Apache, out of the box, is surprisingly insecure. Many best practices and security configurations have to be configured manually before rolling Apache out in a production environment. You may use this GitHub repository as a starting point towards securing your Apache instances. Installing ModSecurity with OWASP Core Rule Set Step 1: Update Repositories On Ubuntu/ Debian:
